body_html:
I think that may be an out-of-memory error, as seen here: #8710; same return code.
…
On Mon, Jun 19, 2017 at 5:05 AM, Gonthier Nicolas ***@***.***> wrote: I have updated my Tensorflow version 1.0.1 to the version 1.2 and I can't reproduce those error with the former script : TestFFT2D.py <https://github.com/nicaogr/silver-octo-fortnight/blob/master/TestFFT2D.py> But when I increase the size of the tensor I used (from 400 * 300 to 800 * 600), I got an Internal Error message again : InternalError2.txt <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/files/1084781/InternalError2.txt> You can test with this script : TestFFT2D_1.py <https://github.com/nicaogr/silver-octo-fortnight/blob/master/TestFFT2D_1.py> (I also reduce the size of the kernel filters). I can get the same type of error when I increase the number of filters I used. Do you advice me to present my problem on StackOverflow instead of Github ? — You are receiving this because you commented. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#10759 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AA1YDsLdIEIspSIkb-soRG7HC8PBjjGrks5sFmP5gaJpZM4N8Upp> .
body_text:
I think that may be an out-of-memory error, as seen here: #8710; same
return code.
…
On Mon, Jun 19, 2017 at 5:05 AM, Gonthier Nicolas ***@***.***> wrote:
 I have updated my Tensorflow version 1.0.1 to the version 1.2 and I can't
 reproduce those error with the former script : TestFFT2D.py
 <https://github.com/nicaogr/silver-octo-fortnight/blob/master/TestFFT2D.py>

 But when I increase the size of the tensor I used (from 400 * 300 to 800 *
 600), I got an Internal Error message again :
 InternalError2.txt
 <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/files/1084781/InternalError2.txt>
 You can test with this script : TestFFT2D_1.py
 <https://github.com/nicaogr/silver-octo-fortnight/blob/master/TestFFT2D_1.py>
 (I also reduce the size of the kernel filters).

 I can get the same type of error when I increase the number of filters I
 used.

 Do you advice me to present my problem on StackOverflow instead of Github ?

 —
 You are receiving this because you commented.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#10759 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AA1YDsLdIEIspSIkb-soRG7HC8PBjjGrks5sFmP5gaJpZM4N8Upp>
 .
body:
I think that may be an out-of-memory error, as seen here: #8710; same
return code.

On Mon, Jun 19, 2017 at 5:05 AM, Gonthier Nicolas <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> I have updated my Tensorflow version 1.0.1 to the version 1.2 and I can't
> reproduce those error with the former script : TestFFT2D.py
> <https://github.com/nicaogr/silver-octo-fortnight/blob/master/TestFFT2D.py>

> 600), I got an Internal Error message again :

> You can test with this script : TestFFT2D_1.py

> (I also reduce the size of the kernel filters).
>
> I can get the same type of error when I increase the number of filters I
> used.
>
> Do you advice me to present my problem on StackOverflow instead of Github ?
>
